name: img
title: DCA Image: Creation, Management and Registry

questions.description: Which of the following is NOT how to create an efficient image via a Dockerfile?
answers: Start with an appropriate base image
Combine multiple applications into a single container

questions.description: What Dockerfile option LABEL does?
answers: Provide defaults for an executing container
Label a container that will run as an executable
Tells Docker how to test a container to check that it is still working

questions.description: Which of the following Dockerfile options creates a mount point with the specified name and marks it as holding externally mounted volumes from native host or other containers?
What does docker image rm command do?
answers: Show the history of an image
Display detailed information on one or more images

questions.description: Which of the following docker image commands display detailed information on one or more images?
What Dockerfile option EXPOSE does?
answers: Label a container that will run as an executable
Expose defaults for an executing container
Informs Docker that the container listens on the specified network ports at runtime

questions.description: Which of the Dockerfile options initializes a new build stage and sets the base image for subsequent instructions?
Which of the Dockerfile options executes any commands in a new layer on top of the current image and commit the results?
What docker image prune command does?
answers: Display detailed information on one or more images
Show the history of an image

questions.description: Dockerfile option EXPOSE publish the port to external systems. True or false?
Which of the following statements is incorrect?
answers: When a container is deleted, the writable layer is persisted.
The column 'virtual size' of docker ps -s output shows the amount of data used for the read-only image data used by the container plus the container's writable layer 'size'.
The column 'size' of docker ps -s output shows the amount of data that is used for the writable layer of each container.
Copy-on-write is a Docker strategy of sharing and copying files for maximum efficiency.

questions.description: Which of the following is NOT a valid way to tag a Docker image?
answers: Tag an image referenced by Name and Tag
Tag an image referenced by image ID
Tag an image referenced by user ID
Tag an image referenced by Name

questions.description: What is the docker command to pull an image or a repository from a registry?
Which of the following is the correct command to tag an image?
What is the image storage solution that is part of Docker Enterprise Edition called?
Each container shares common writeable container layer. True or false?
What is the docker command for displaying layers of a Docker image?
Which of the following is the correct command to store an image to a registry?
What is the docker command to remove one or more images?
Docker image is built up from a series of layers and each layer represents an instruction in the image's Dockerfile.
